sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SECACUL, in the materia medica of the ancients, a name given by Avicenna, Serapion, and others, to a root which was like ginger, and was brought from the Eaſt Indies, and uſed as a provocative to venery. The interpreters of their works have rendered this word iringo; and hence ſome have ſuppoſed that our eryngium or eryngo was the root meant by it: but this does not appear to be the caſe on a ſtrict inquiry, and there is ſome reaſon to believe that the famous root, at this time called gin ſ eng, was what they meant.
